alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Piscataquis and northwestern Penobscot Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Katahdin, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millinocket, Mount Katahdin, Baxter State Park, southwestern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Norcross and Grindstone. This includes State Highway 11 between Norcross and Millinocket. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
